verses.verse: Do not boast<WH1984> about tomorrow,<WH4279> For you do not know<WH3045> what<WH4100> a day<WH3117> may bring<WH3205> forth.<WH3205>
Let another<WH2114> praise<WH1984> you, and not your own mouth;<WH6310> A stranger,<WH5237> and not your own lips.<WH8193>
A stone<WH68> is heavy<WH3514> and the sand<WH2344> weighty,<WH5192> But the provocation<WH3708> of a fool<WH191> is heavier<WH3515> than<WH4480> both<WH8147> of them.
Wrath<WH2534> is fierce<WH395> and anger<WH639> is a flood,<WH7858> But who<WH4310> can stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> jealousy<WH7068>?
Better<WH2896> is open<WH1540> rebuke<WH9640> Than<WH4480> love<WH160> that is concealed.<WH5641>
Faithful<WH539> are the wounds<WH6482> of a friend,<WH157> But deceitful<WH6280> are the kisses<WH5390> of an enemy.<WH8130>
A sated<WH7649> man<WH5315> loathes<WH947> honey,<WH5317> But to a famished<WH7457> man<WH5315> any<WH3605> bitter<WH4751> thing<WH4751> is sweet.<WH4966>
Like a bird<WH6833> that wanders<WH5074> from her nest,<WH7064> So<WH3651> is a man<WH376> who wanders<WH5074> from his home.<WH4725>
Oil<WH8081> and perfume<WH7004> make<WH8055> the heart<WH3820> glad,<WH8055> So a man's counsel<WH6098> is sweet<WH4986> to his friend.<WH7453>

Do not forsake<WH5800> your own friend<WH7453> or your father's friend,<WH7453> And do not go<WH935> to your brother<WH251>'s house<WH1004> in the day<WH3117> of your calamity;<WH343> Better<WH2896> is a neighbor<WH7934> who is near<WH7138> than<WH4480> a brother far<WH7350> away.
Be wise,<WH2449> my son,<WH1121> and make<WH8055> my heart<WH3820> glad,<WH8055> That I may reply<WH7725> <WH1697> to him who reproaches<WH2778> me.
A prudent<WH6175> man<WH6175> sees<WH7200> evil<WH9567> [and] hides<WH5641> himself, The naive<WH6612> proceed<WH5674> [and] pay<WH6064> the penalty.<WH6064>
Take<WH3947> his garment<WH899> when<WH3588> he becomes<WH6148> surety<WH6148> for a stranger;<WH2114> And for an adulterous<WH5237> woman<WH5237> hold<WH9111> him in pledge.<WH9111>
He who blesses<WH1288> his friend<WH7453> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963> early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> It will be reckoned<WH2803> a curse<WH7045> to him.
A constant<WH2956> dripping<WH1812> on a day<WH3117> of steady<WH5464> rain<WH5464> And a contentious<WH4066> woman<WH802> are alike;<WH9586>
He who would restrain<WH6845> her restrains<WH6845> the wind,<WH7307> And grasps<WH7121> oil<WH8081> with his right<WH3225> hand.<WH3225>
Iron<WH1270> sharpens<WH9120> iron,<WH1270> So one man<WH376> sharpens<WH9120> another.<WH6440> <WH7453>
He who tends<WH5341> the fig<WH8384> tree<WH8384> will eat<WH398> its fruit;<WH6529> And he who cares<WH8104> for his master<WH113> will be honored.<WH3513>
As in water<WH4325> face<WH6440> [reflects] face,<WH6440> So<WH3651> the heart<WH3820> of man<WH120> [reflects] man.<WH120>
Sheol<WH7585> and Abaddon<WH11> are never<WH3808> satisfied,<WH7646> Nor<WH3808> are the eyes<WH5869> of man<WH120> ever satisfied.<WH7646>
The crucible<WH4715> is for silver<WH3701> and the furnace<WH3564> for gold,<WH2091> And a man<WH376> [is tested] by the praise<WH4110> accorded<WH6310> him.
Though<WH518> you pound<WH3806> a fool<WH191> in a mortar<WH4388> with a pestle<WH5940> along<WH8432> with crushed<WH7383> grain,<WH7383> [Yet] his folly<WH200> will not depart<WH5493> from him.
Know<WH3045> well<WH3045> the condition<WH6440> of your flocks,<WH6629> [And] pay<WH7896> attention<WH3820> to your herds;<WH5739>
For riches<WH2633> are not forever,<WH5769> Nor<WH518> does a crown<WH5145> [endure] to all<WH1755> generations.<WH1755>
[When] the grass<WH2682> disappears,<WH1540> the new<WH1877> growth<WH1877> is seen,<WH7200> And the herbs<WH6212> of the mountains<WH2022> are gathered<WH622> in,
The lambs<WH3532> [will be] for your clothing,<WH3830> And the goats<WH6260> [will bring] the price<WH4242> of a field,<WH7704>
And [there will be] goats' milk<WH2461> enough<WH1767> for your food,<WH3899> For the food<WH3899> of your household,<WH1004> And sustenance<WH9132> for your maidens.<WH5291>
